byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura reported from Brussels, and Katrin Bennhold from London. Milan Schreuer contributed reporting from Brussels.
byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS, KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA and KATRIN BENNHOLD

abstract: Belgian and French authorities in Brussels district of Molenbeek, which has a heavy concentration of immigrants, were aware of future terrorist Ibrahim Abdeslam; their inability to stop him from blowing himself up in Paris during terrorist attacks represents costly missed opportunity, and raises troubling questions about intelligence services; Molenbeek is well known as haven for terrorists.
lead_paragraph: Molenbeek, a known haven for extremists, was home to Ibrahim Abdeslam, who blew himself up in Paris. Although the authorities there had him in their sights, he slipped through their fingers.

headline.main: In Suspects’ Brussels Neighborhood, a History of Petty Crimes and Missed Chances
headline.print_headline: In Neighborhood Known for Extremists, a Trail of Petty Crimes and Missed Plots

snippet: Molenbeek, a known haven for extremists, was home to Ibrahim Abdeslam, who blew himself up in Paris. Although the authorities there had him in their sights, he slipped through their fingers.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
